messages.message: when setting this up for my dev-setup, which account/role should I choose?
Are you following a dev env setup doc? Everyone in div-Engineering should have the `BaseEng` role in the instabase account and the `powerUser` role in the instabase-dev account
Ah, if you're looking at this doc (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1yQOCxOISV_ukUxXdPJDoN-rERtOhdVRe7zv1swF1igw/edit#) then it's the baseEng role

yes, but which one should i pick when setting up AWS SSO? I’m following the instructions here (https://instabase.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/IT/pages/1947435025/Setting+up+SSO+for+the+AWS+CLI). I don’t know which of instabase, instabase-dev or instabase-compliance I need
the viewOnly role doesn't have the s3 permissions
It depends what aws account the resources you're trying to access are in
I don’t know which one I’m accessing. it’s whatever the dev setup requires?
I actually don’t really remember why we need AWS CLI access for dev setup. I think maybe it’s to download certain models in some of the docker builds?
we need it to download the oracle driver for one
Ah, yeah, and the db drivers
yep
that's the baseEng role in the instabase account
there's some s3 buckets those drivers are in
@lenny do you know if we need it for the dev setup to read our S3 buckets? for file service
that I don’t know, sorry
picking instabase/baseEng worked for me!

btw the cli didn’t prompt me for a session name (step 3b in https://instabase.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/IT/pages/1947435025/Setting+up+SSO+for+the+AWS+CLI)

but it seems that you can log in using the profile name as well - `aws sso login --profile profile-name` https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/userguide/sso-using-profile.html#sso-using-profile-sign-in
Ah, good note, I'll add that to the docs. Thanks!
Has anyone on the eng side successfully followed the docs of guidance here to fully migrate their set up and make their local dev work?
I believe so, and at least one engineer has started after we switched to the SSO access paradigm and so her environment was set up this way from the start.
is there a way to see your profile name if you later forget what it was?
I think this one person would be a great resource for providing tips and instructions here
@lydia you should be able to see them in your `~/.aws/config` file

Yeah but I'm reluctant to throw anyone into a thread like this and have them be voluntold to answer people's questions. It's Xindi Xu- I have seen that she added some comments on the dev onboarding google doc (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1yQOCxOISV_ukUxXdPJDoN-rERtOhdVRe7zv1swF1igw/edit#).
ooo right! Xindi just joined :smile:
Thanks, that's great. If eng folks take a gossip protocol to help themselves when needed, then there will be less burden on your shoulder when prime time comes. :stuck_out_tongue_closed_eyes:
